action.action-desc: Mr. Emmer (for himself, Ms. Pingree, and Mrs. Fischbach) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food, Agriculture, and Trade Act of 1990 to establish a grant program for eligible institutions to carry out agriculture workforce training programs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Establishment of agriculture workforce training grant program

subsection.text: Subsection (d) of section 2501 of the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 (Public Law 101–624; 7 U.S.C. 2279(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary, acting through the Director of the National Institute of Food and Agriculture, shall establish a program to award grants to eligible institutions to develop and carry out agriculture workforce training programs to—

clause.text: promote the growth of the agriculture industry;
foster competitiveness within such industry; and
improve the training and retention of workers in the agriculture industry.

subparagraph.text: An eligible institution awarded a grant under this paragraph shall use not less than 5 percent of funds received through such grant to implement an agriculture workforce training program. Such implementation shall include—

clause.text: preliminary recruitment measures to encourage students to participate in such agriculture workforce training program; and
professional development sessions to train faculty to prepare students for employment in the agriculture industry.

The term agriculture workforce training program means a training program developed by an eligible institution in collaboration with a targeted industry partner through which students enrolled at such eligible institution receive training from such targeted industry partner, including through the use of—

subclause.text: educational programs and workshops to promote technical skills.

a non-land-grant college of agriculture or land-grant colleges and universities (as such terms are defined in section 1404 of the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977 (Public Law 95–113; 7 U.S.C. 3103));
a 1994 Institution (as defined in section 532 of the Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1994 (Public Law 103–382; 7 U.S.C. 301 note));
a center of excellence recognized under section 1673;
a junior or community college (as defined in section 312 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (Public Law 89–329; 20 U.S.C. 1058)) which offers a program of study in agriculture; or

an area career and technical education school (as defined in section 3 of the Carl D. Perkins Career and Technical Education Act of 2006 (Public Law 88–210; 20 U.S.C. 2302)) which offers a program of study in agriculture.

clause.text: The term targeted industry partner means 1 or more of the following entities:

subclause.text: A member of the agriculture industry, such as a company or industry association.
An apprenticeship program in agriculture registered under the Act of August 16, 1937 (commonly known as the National Apprenticeship Act; 29 U.S.C. 50 et seq.).
A nonprofit organization that aims to help individuals gain employment in the agriculture industry.

subsection.text: Not later than January 31, 2024, the Secretary of Agriculture shall implement the program established by paragraph (16) of such subsection, as added by subsection (a).
